panels.description: If it's much bigger than 1, means that NGW is not working properly.
panels.title: Outgoing SMS Handling Rate

panels.description: Answer distribution for all outgoing calls.
panels.title: Outgoing Call Request Answers Distribution

panels.description:
SMG Radius Receive Distribution Chart.
Radius packets that came as answers to CoA Requests.
panels.title: SMG Radius Receive Distribution Chart

panels.description:
If this rate goes significantly higher than, it means
that NGW or SMG is not working properly.
0 means that there are no requests for now.
panels.title: SMG Send-Receive CoA Rate

panels.description:
If this rate goes upper than 1, it means that SMG or
NGW is not working properly.
If it's absent - there is no requests to SMG or it's 
disabled.
panels.title: SMG Radius Send-Receive CoA Rate

panels.description:
Number of Incoming Events to Process from Gateways.
Is Requested means that this event was already requested by NGW client.
panels.title: Count of Incoming Events to Process

panels.description:
Count of Requests that is came from NGW clients.
Tag has subscription means that this requested was 
answered before the request came to NGW.
It can mean that it was requested before, or action was performed earlier that NGW client has made a request.
panels.title: Count of Requests That is Awaiting Event

panels.description:
Event to Request Rate.
If equals 1, everything is fine.
If less than 1, NGW is overloaded or gateway is overloaded.
If more than 1, events are coming faster than actual requests.
panels.title: Event to Request rate

panels.title: SBC Successful Radius Packets count
